lessonTopics: Lesson 1: Gut Health Foundation - What gut health really is, the gut-brain connection science, 5 root causes of digestive dysfunction, scope of practice for gut health coaches
Lesson 2: The D.E.P.T.H. Method - Discover, Eliminate, Populate, Transform, Heal framework for systematic gut restoration
Lesson 3: Getting Your First Clients - Warm market strategy for gut health, pricing digestive wellness packages, income math, 30-day launch plan
painPoints: Years of suffering from bloating, IBS, constipation, or diarrhea with no real answers from doctors
Being told it's 'just stress' or 'all in your head' when they know something is physically wrong
Living in fear of food - afraid to eat at restaurants, travel, or commit to plans
Planning entire life around bathroom access and proximity to toilets
Embarrassment and shame about digestive issues that prevents them from talking about it
Ruined social lives because they can't predict when symptoms will strike
Helping friends and family with gut issues for free but lacking professional framework or credentials
terminology: Microbiome - the ecosystem of trillions of bacteria living in the digestive tract that affect everything from mood to immunity
D.E.P.T.H. Method - Discover, Eliminate, Populate, Transform, Heal framework for gut restoration
5 Root Causes - Food sensitivities, dysbiosis, leaky gut, stress-gut connection, digestive enzyme insufficiency
Leaky gut (intestinal permeability) - when the gut lining becomes compromised allowing particles to enter bloodstream
Elimination diet protocols - structured removal and reintroduction of foods to identify triggers
Food sensitivities vs allergies - delayed immune responses vs immediate reactions, both affecting digestion
Gut-brain axis - the bidirectional communication between the gut and brain affecting mood, anxiety, and cognition
Probiotics and prebiotics - beneficial bacteria and the fiber that feeds them for microbiome health
Dysbiosis - imbalance in gut bacteria that causes digestive symptoms and systemic inflammation
Scope of practice - facilitate digestive wellness without diagnosing conditions or replacing medical care
clientExamples: Women 40-55 who've suffered from IBS, bloating, or chronic digestive issues for years without answers
Those who've been dismissed by doctors with 'it's just stress' or told to take more fiber
Women afraid to eat - fearful of triggering symptoms, avoiding social situations involving food
People who plan their entire lives around bathroom access and can't travel or commit to events
Those dealing with food anxiety and a broken relationship with eating
Anyone who says 'I feel like my gut is controlling my life' or 'I don't trust my body anymore'
practiceType: Gut health coaching focused on elimination protocols, microbiome restoration, food sensitivity identification, stress-gut connection, and digestive wellness education
